footer.subscribe: Subscribe to our twice a week
footer.subscribeDesc: Get uplifting Sermons delivered to your inbox every week. Stay inspired and connected with God.

home.title: Welcome to International Anglican Revival Church of Edmonton
home.subtitle: International Anglican Revival Church of Edmonton

about.title: About Us
about.church: The International Anglican Revival Church of Edmonton is a vibrant Christian community dedicated to spiritual growth, compassion, and service. We are an Anglican-Pentecostal/Protestant church committed to preaching the Gospel, nurturing families, and empowering believers for a purpose-driven life.
about.congregation: We serve a diverse congregation in Edmonton, including Canadians and African communities, offering worship services in English and Kinyarwanda.
about.ministry: Our ministry extends beyond Canada, partnering with churches in Africa and supporting vulnerable refugees, widows, orphans, and displaced families in Uganda, Kenya, Rwanda, and other regions.
about.visionText: To connect families and communities—both in Edmonton and globally—to transformational development, spiritual growth, and faith-based opportunities that promote holistic wellbeing and sustainable change.
about.missionText: Our mission is to empower individuals and communities through spiritual formation, social support, and holistic development. We promote faith-driven aspirations that help vulnerable groups realize their God-given potential.
marksList: Proclaim the Good News of the Kingdom of God.
Challenge and transform unjust structures in society.
Support church planting and spiritual development in Africa.
Implement programs that serve refugees and vulnerable families in Africa.
about.pastorBio: Rev. Sengiyumva is a dedicated servant of God with a passion for multi-lingual ministry. Although English is not his first language, he faithfully ministers in English and Kinyarwanda to reach and uplift diverse communities. His calling is rooted in Jeremiah 20:9, carrying God's Word like fire in his bones.
about.coreValuesDesc: These fundamental values guide everything we do as a church community, shaping our mission, ministry, and relationships.

values.title: Faith
values.description: We trust in God's Word and His promises, living by faith and not by sight. Our faith in Jesus Christ is the foundation of our church.

values.title: Love
values.description: We demonstrate Christ's unconditional love to everyone, showing compassion, kindness, and acceptance to all people regardless of their background.

values.title: Service
values.description: We serve God and others with humility and dedication, following Christ's example of servant leadership in our community and beyond.

values.title: Community
values.description: We build authentic relationships and fellowship, creating a welcoming family where everyone belongs and can grow together in faith.

values.title: Integrity
values.description: We live with honesty, transparency, and moral principles, reflecting Christ's character in all our actions and decisions.

about.statementOfFaithDesc: We believe in the fundamental truths of the Christian faith as revealed in the Holy Scriptures.
statementOfFaithItems: We believe in one God, eternally existent in three persons: Father, Son, and Holy Spirit.

We believe in the deity of our Lord Jesus Christ, in His virgin birth, in His sinless life, in His miracles, in His atoning death, in His bodily resurrection, and in His ascension to the right hand of the Father.
We believe in the present ministry of the Holy Spirit, by whose indwelling the Christian is enabled to live a godly life.
We believe in the Bible as the inspired, infallible, and authoritative Word of God.
We believe in the resurrection of both the saved and the lost: the saved unto the resurrection of life, and the lost unto the resurrection of damnation.
We believe in the spiritual unity of believers in our Lord Jesus Christ.
about.historyDesc: The International Anglican Revival Church of Edmonton was established to serve the growing international and multicultural community in Edmonton, particularly those from African backgrounds seeking a place of worship that honors both Anglican tradition and Pentecostal expression.
historyContent: Founded with a vision to bridge cultures and languages, our church began as a small gathering of believers committed to sharing the Gospel in both English and Kinyarwanda.
Over the years, we have grown into a vibrant community that serves not only the local Edmonton area but also extends our ministry to support vulnerable communities in Africa.
Today, we continue to be a beacon of hope, providing spiritual guidance, community support, and practical assistance to those in need, both locally and globally.

ministries.title: Our Ministries
ministries.worshipDesc: Engaging worship services that celebrate God's presence through music, prayer, and praise.
ministries.youthDesc: Empowering the next generation through discipleship, fellowship, and spiritual growth opportunities.
ministries.childrenDesc: Nurturing young hearts with age-appropriate teaching, activities, and care in a safe environment.
ministries.womenDesc: Building community and supporting women through Bible study, fellowship, and mutual encouragement.
ministries.menDesc: Strengthening men through accountability, mentorship, and biblical teaching.
ministries.missionsDesc: Extending God's love globally through partnerships, support programs, and community service.

services.title: Service Times
services.sundayDesc: Join us for our main worship service featuring inspiring messages, uplifting music, and fellowship.
services.prayerDesc: Mid-week prayer gathering for intercession, encouragement, and spiritual renewal.
services.bibleDesc: Deep dive into Scripture with discussion, questions, and practical application.

sermons.title: Sermons & Messages
sermons.comingSoon: New sermons coming soon. Check back regularly for updates.

form.name: Name
form.success: Thank you! Your message has been sent.
form.error: Something went wrong. Please try again.

africa.title: Our Work in Africa
africa.description: Our church maintains active partnerships with congregations and refugee communities in Uganda, Kenya, and Rwanda. Through these collaborations we offer:
africa.bibles: Distribution of Bibles and Christian resources

partners.title: Partners & Affiliations
partners.individuals: Individual supporters moved by compassion and the Gospel message

volunteer.title: Volunteer
volunteer.subtitle: Serve in various ministries and make a difference in our community.
volunteer.opportunitiesDesc: We welcome volunteers who want to serve and make a difference in our community. Whether you're interested in music, children's ministry, outreach, or administration, there's a place for you to serve at International Anglican Revival Church of Edmonton.
volunteer.readyDesc: Fill out the form on the right to get started. We'll be in touch soon to discuss how you can serve in our community.

membership.title: Become a Member
membership.subtitle: Join our church family and become an official member of International Anglican Revival Church of Edmonton.
membership.processDesc: Becoming a member of International Anglican Revival Church of Edmonton means committing to our community, mission, and vision. We welcome all who want to be part of our church family.
membership.attendDesc: Regularly attend our worship services and get to know our community.
membership.classDesc: Participate in our membership orientation to learn about our beliefs, mission, and expectations.
membership.commitmentDesc: Make a commitment to support the church through prayer, service, and giving.
membership.readyDesc: Fill out the registration form on the right to begin your membership journey. We'll be in touch soon to discuss next steps.

prayer.title: Prayer
prayer.subtitle: Join our prayer groups and intercessory prayer ministry.
prayer.ministryDesc: Prayer is at the heart of our church. We believe in the power of prayer and encourage everyone to participate in our prayer ministry.
prayer.weeklyDesc: Join us every Wednesday at 7:00 PM for our mid-week prayer gathering.
prayer.requestsDesc: Submit your prayer requests and our prayer team will intercede on your behalf.
prayer.teamDesc: Join our dedicated team of intercessors who pray regularly for the church, community, and world.
prayer.joinDesc: Fill out the form on the right to submit your prayer request. Our prayer team will be praying for you.

baptism.title: Get Baptized
baptism.subtitle: Take the next step in your faith journey through baptism.
baptism.aboutDesc: Baptism is a public declaration of your faith in Jesus Christ. It symbolizes your identification with Christ's death, burial, and resurrection, and your commitment to follow Him.
baptism.whyDesc2: It's a public declaration of your faith
baptism.whyDesc3: It's a step of obedience in your Christian walk
baptism.processDesc: If you're ready to be baptized, we'd love to help you take this important step. Fill out the form on the right to:
baptism.process2: Learn more about what baptism means
baptism.process3: Set a date for your baptism
baptism.readyDesc: Fill out the form on the right to submit your baptism request. We'll be in touch soon to schedule your baptism orientation.

donate.title: Donate
donate.subtitle: Your generous giving helps us continue our mission of serving communities in Edmonton and around the world.
donate.inPersonDesc: You can give during our Sunday worship services or drop off your offering at the church office.
donate.eTransferDesc: Send an e-transfer to our church email. Contact us for the email address and security question.
donate.bankTransferDesc: For recurring donations or larger amounts, contact us for our bank account details.
donate.everyGiftDesc: Your contributions support our ministries, missions, community outreach, and church operations. Every gift, no matter the size, makes a difference in advancing God's kingdom.

servicesSermons.title: Services and Sermons
servicesSermons.subtitle: Join us for worship, prayer, and fellowship throughout the week.
servicesSermons.whatToExpectDesc: Our services are welcoming and inclusive, featuring inspiring messages, uplifting music, and warm fellowship. We offer worship in English and Kinyarwanda. Whether you're visiting for the first time or are a regular member, you'll find a place to belong and grow in faith.

foundation.title: Shelter of Refugee Seniors International Ministries
foundation.subtitle: Serving vulnerable refugees, seniors, and displaced families with compassion and dignity
foundation.aboutDesc: Shelter of Refugee Seniors International Ministries (SRSIM) is a compassionate ministry dedicated to serving vulnerable refugees, seniors, and displaced families around the world. We provide essential support, resources, and hope to those who have been forced to flee their homes due to conflict, persecution, or natural disasters.
foundation.missionText: To provide shelter, support, and spiritual care to refugee seniors and displaced families, helping them rebuild their lives with dignity and hope while sharing the love of Christ.
foundation.visionText: A world where every refugee senior and displaced family has access to safe shelter, essential resources, spiritual support, and the opportunity to rebuild their lives with dignity and hope.

valuesList.title: Compassion
valuesList.desc: We approach every person with empathy, understanding, and genuine care for their unique circumstances and needs.

valuesList.title: Dignity
valuesList.desc: We respect and honor the inherent worth of every individual, treating all with the respect they deserve.

valuesList.title: Service
valuesList.desc: We are committed to serving others selflessly, following Christ's example of servant leadership.

valuesList.title: Hope
valuesList.desc: We provide not just material support, but also spiritual encouragement and hope for a better future.

valuesList.title: Partnership
valuesList.desc: We work collaboratively with local communities, churches, and organizations to maximize our impact.

programsList.title: Shelter & Housing
programsList.desc: Providing safe and secure housing for refugee seniors and families who have lost their homes.

programsList.title: Food & Nutrition
programsList.desc: Ensuring access to nutritious meals and food security for vulnerable families and seniors.

programsList.title: Healthcare Support
programsList.desc: Connecting refugees with essential healthcare services and medical assistance.

programsList.title: Education & Training
programsList.desc: Offering educational opportunities and skills training to help refugees rebuild their lives.

programsList.title: Spiritual Care
programsList.desc: Providing pastoral care, Bible study, and spiritual support to nurture faith and hope.

programsList.title: Community Building
programsList.desc: Creating supportive communities where refugees can find belonging and mutual support.

foundation.impactDesc: Through our programs, we have been able to support hundreds of refugee families and seniors across multiple countries, providing them with essential resources, spiritual care, and hope for the future.
foundation.getInvolvedDesc: You can make a difference in the lives of refugee seniors and displaced families. Join us in our mission to provide shelter, support, and hope.
foundation.donateDesc: Your financial contributions help us provide essential resources, shelter, and support to those in need.
foundation.volunteerDesc: Join our team of dedicated volunteers who serve refugees and displaced families in various capacities.
foundation.prayDesc: Pray for the refugees we serve, our ministry team, and for peace and stability in regions affected by displacement.
foundation.partnerDesc: Churches and organizations can partner with us to expand our reach and impact in serving refugees worldwide.

cta.title: Join Us This Sunday
cta.subtitle: Experience the love of God in a welcoming, multicultural community. We'd love to have you join us!

leadership.title: Church Leadership & Administration
leadership.subtitle: Meet the dedicated leaders who guide and serve our church community.
leadership.seniorPastorBio: Rev. Sengiyumva is a dedicated servant of God with a passion for multi-lingual ministry. Although English is not his first language, he faithfully ministers in English and Kinyarwanda to reach and uplift diverse communities. His calling is rooted in Jeremiah 20:9, carrying God's Word like fire in his bones. He leads our church with wisdom, compassion, and a heart for serving both the local community in Edmonton and our global mission work in Africa.
leadership.pastorsDesc: Our pastoral team works alongside the Senior Pastor to provide spiritual guidance, pastoral care, and leadership in various ministries. They are committed to nurturing the congregation and supporting the church's mission.
leadership.otherLeadersDesc: Our church is blessed with dedicated leaders who serve in various capacities including ministry directors, deacons, and administrative staff. These faithful servants help ensure the smooth operation of our church and support our mission to serve God and our community.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.subtitle: Your privacy is important to us. Learn how we collect, use, and protect your personal information.

introduction.title: Introduction
introduction.content: International Anglican Revival Church of Edmonton ('we', 'our', or 'us') is committed to protecting your privacy. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, disclose, and safeguard your information when you visit our website, use our services, or interact with us. Please read this privacy policy carefully. If you do not agree with the terms of this privacy policy, please do not access the site.

collection.title: Information We Collect
content: We collect information that you provide directly to us, including:
We may also automatically collect certain information about your device when you access our website, including:
list: Personal identification information (name, email address, phone number, mailing address)
Information you provide when registering for events, volunteering, or becoming a member
Payment information when making donations (processed securely through third-party payment processors)
Information submitted through contact forms, prayer requests, or other communication channels
Your IP address and browser type
Pages you visit and time spent on pages
Referring website addresses
Device information and operating system

usage.title: How We Use Your Information
content: We use the information we collect for various purposes, including:
list: To provide, maintain, and improve our services and website
To process donations and manage financial transactions
To send you updates, newsletters, and information about our services and events
To respond to your inquiries, comments, and requests
To manage volunteer registrations and church membership
To comply with legal obligations and protect our rights
To analyze website usage and improve user experience

protection.title: Data Protection and Security
content: We implement appropriate technical and organizational security measures to protect your personal information against unauthorized access, alteration, disclosure, or destruction. However, no method of transmission over the Internet or electronic storage is 100% secure. While we strive to use commercially acceptable means to protect your personal information, we cannot guarantee its absolute security.

cookies.title: Cookies and Tracking Technologies
content: We use cookies and similar tracking technologies to track activity on our website and store certain information. Cookies are files with a small amount of data which may include an anonymous unique identifier. You can instruct your browser to refuse all cookies or to indicate when a cookie is being sent. However, if you do not accept cookies, you may not be able to use some portions of our website.

rights.title: Your Privacy Rights
content: Depending on your location, you may have certain rights regarding your personal information, including:
list: The right to access – You have the right to request copies of your personal data
The right to rectification – You have the right to request correction of inaccurate information
The right to erasure – You have the right to request deletion of your personal data
The right to restrict processing – You have the right to request restriction of processing your personal data
The right to object to processing – You have the right to object to our processing of your personal data
The right to data portability – You have the right to request transfer of your data to another service

children.title: Children's Privacy
content: Our website and services are not directed to children under the age of 13. We do not knowingly collect personal information from children under 13. If you are a parent or guardian and believe your child has provided us with personal information, please contact us immediately.

changes.title: Changes to This Privacy Policy
content: We may update our Privacy Policy from time to time. We will notify you of any changes by posting the new Privacy Policy on this page and updating the 'Last updated' date. You are advised to review this Privacy Policy periodically for any changes.

contact.title: Contact Us
content: If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy or wish to exercise your privacy rights, please contact us at:
International Anglican Revival Church of Edmonton
6110 Fulton Road, Edmonton, AB T6A 3T3, Canada
You can also visit our Contact page for more information.
